nodes.bodyText: so this is the equivalent of Mono.error or Flux.error in PollerFlux.  The activation will never succeeded so all subscriptions are going to get the error from the activation stage. The other functions (finalResult, Poll) will never get called. lgtm.
Yes, that's correct! This will return the error from activation function. Since poll, finalResult and cancel functions cannot be null, I just add the same error to all of them.

Initially, I started with Throwable but it conflicts with Flux's error method.
So, cannot use Throwable here:
'error(Throwable)' in 'com.azure.core.util.polling.PollerFlux' clashes with 'error(Throwable)' in 'reactor.core.publisher.Flux'; both methods have same erasure, yet neither hides the other
Do we want this to take a ClientLogger so the exception can be logged? Or is it expected for the caller to log this exception?
This would follow the pattern when dealing with Mono.error, Flux.error, and PagedFlux.error.

Logging is expected to be done by the caller. This is just like Mono.error().
What you are referring to is FluxUtils.monoError().
